preliminary.translation[0].definitions[0: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it
the preliminary stages of the competition
The discussions were preliminary to preparing a policy paper.
preliminary.translation[1].definitions[0: something that is said or done first, to introduce or prepare for something else
After the usual preliminaries, the chairman made his announcement.
Pilot studies are a useful preliminary to large research projects.
preliminary.translation[1].definitions[1: one of the games in the first part of a competition, when it is decided who will go on to the main competition
Four teams will be eliminated in the preliminaries.
preliminary.translation[2].definitions[0: coming before something more official, more important etc
Preliminary estimates indicate that earnings will decline substantially from a year ago.
The group will set the preliminary pricing for $235 million revenue bonds.
They obtained apreliminary injunction (=a legal ruling, stopping someone doing something) against the company.
